comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Scandal:  Miss Tanzer accused a lawyer named James W. Osborne of seduction/breach of promise; at the trial, it became clear that he wasn't the man she said he was.  She was arrested for perjury, using the mails with intent to defraud, and conspiracy charges involving her sisters (Dora and Rose), and a hotel clerk, and a detective.

Her lawyer:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/7118553485/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Rae Tanzer:

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Testimony in the criminal conspiracy trial of her lawyers, David and Maxwell Slade, for bringing the suit against Osborne because of a grudge stemming from a prior case he had with Osborne, commenced in Federal Court in New York City on June 26, 1915. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60A10F6395B17738... Her own Federal perjury trial was going on at about the same time. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0912FA3C5F13738... The criminal proceedings against Rae Tanzer and others who were part of the suit against James W. Osborne were still going on in 1920, when they were ended by the death of Mr. Osborne. select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0F1FFC385F1B72...
